title: Login success with valid credentials
description: Verify that a user can log in successfully using valid credentials for each role (Admin, Docente, Alumno).

steps.description: Navigate to the login page
Input valid username/email and password for Admin role
Click login button
Verify login is successful and user is redirected to appropriate dashboard
Logout and repeat for Docente role
Logout and repeat for Alumno role

title: Login failure with invalid credentials
description: Verify that login fails and an error message is displayed when invalid credentials are used.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page
Input invalid username/email or password
Click login button
Verify login is denied and proper error message is shown

title: User role access control enforcement
description: Verify that Row Level Security and role-based restrictions correctly prevent unauthorized access to resources for Admin, Docente, and Alumno roles.

steps.description: Log in as Alumno
Attempt to access administration or grade entry pages
Verify access is denied or options are hidden
Log in as Docente
Attempt to perform administrator-only actions such as period management or student imports
Verify access is denied

title: Opening and closing grading periods
description: Verify that an administrator can open and close grading periods and that these actions enable or disable grade entry accordingly.

steps.description: Log in as administrator
Navigate to period management page
Open a new grading period
Verify that the period status is updated to open
Log in as Docente, select assigned subject
Verify grade entry is enabled for open period
Log back in as administrator and close the grading period
Verify the period status is updated to closed
Log in as Docente again
Verify grade entry is disabled for closed period

title: Grades entry and automatic calculation of averages and achievements
description: Verify that teachers can enter partial grades, intensification, and attendance for students and that the system automatically calculates the final average, achievement, and suggested accompaniment plan according to official norms.

steps.description: Log in as Docente
Select assigned subject and open grade entry interface
Enter partial grades, intensification scores, and attendance states for multiple students
Verify that the system calculates and displays correct averages
Verify that achievement status and recommended trayecto de acompa√±amiento is correctly suggested based on normative logic
Modify a grade to an edge case value (e.g., minimum and maximum possible)
Verify recalculation is accurate and UI updates accordingly

title: Attendance recording with daily different statuses
description: Verify that attendance can be recorded daily with states: Presente, Ausente, Tarde, Justificado and that data can be edited and audited by administrator.

steps.description: Log in as Docente
Access daily attendance interface for assigned course
Set attendance statuses for students to each possible state
Verify that attendance data is saved correctly
Log in as administrator
Edit existing attendance data
Verify changes are saved and audit trail is maintained

title: Bulk import of students via CSV
description: Ensure the administrator can successfully import a bulk CSV file of student data which automatically creates user accounts in Supabase Auth and student profiles in the database.

steps.description: Log in as administrator
Navigate to student management and open CSV import component
Upload a valid CSV file with multiple students
Verify that users and profiles are created successfully
Verify correct error handling is shown if CSV contains invalid data or is malformed

title: Generation of official PDF grade report (Boletin)
description: Verify that the administrator can generate official PDF boletines with correct institutional formatting and accurate data from student records.

steps.description: Log in as administrator
Navigate to report generation section
Select a course and period
Request generation of boletines
Verify that PDFs are generated with the official school design
Verify data accuracy for all students included

title: Responsive UI verification on common devices and browsers
description: Verify that the user interface functions correctly and displays properly on common browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Safari) and devices (desktop, tablet, mobile).

steps.description: Access the system on desktop browser Chrome
Verify all pages render properly and are fully functional
Access the system on tablet and mobile devices using multiple browsers
Verify UI elements adjust responsively and no features are broken or inaccessible

title: Disallowed grades input outside open grading periods
description: Verify that grade entry and editing are disabled for Docente users when grading periods are closed.

steps.description: Log in as administrator and ensure grading period is closed
Log in as Docente
Navigate to grade entry for assigned subject
Verify that UI disables grade input fields or shows warning that period is closed
Attempt to submit grades via API or UI directly
Verify grade submission is rejected and relevant error message is shown

title: Student read-only access to their own grades and attendance
description: Verify that students can log in and view their own historical grades and attendance in read-only mode without access to modify any data.

steps.description: Log in as Alumno
Navigate to personal grade and attendance history page
Verify that student can view complete histories with accurate data
Verify that no input fields or editing options are available
Attempt direct URL or API request to modify grades or attendance
Verify operation is denied with appropriate error

title: Subjects, divisions and assignments management by administrator
description: Verify that administrators can create, edit, and delete school subjects, divisions (courses), and assign teachers to them correctly.

steps.description: Log in as administrator
Navigate to subject management and create a new subject
Verify new subject is saved and visible in listings
Edit an existing subject
Verify updates persist
Navigate to division management and create a new course division
Verify division creation is successful
Assign a docente to subject and division
Verify assignments link teacher correctly to courses and subjects
Delete a subject or division
Verify deletion succeeds and UI updates properly

title: Error handling on CSV import with invalid or malformed files
description: Verify that the system properly detects and reports errors when the CSV import file is invalid, malformed, or missing required fields.

steps.description: Log in as administrator
Navigate to student CSV import
Upload malformed CSV file (e.g., missing headers, invalid format)
Verify that a clear, specific error message is displayed
Upload CSV with invalid data types or missing mandatory fields
Verify that errors are highlighted and import is rejected
